quote: Enjoying the view?
I'm stuck on this new story I'm    working on. Coming here helps me    focus --
No need to explain yourself,    Mister Sisko.
I just thought...
You thought what?
I thought you were going to ask me   to leave.
Why would I do that?
You always used to chase me away.
I never chased you away...   I chased Nog. You just happened to   be with him.       So, unless you plan on flicking   sandpeas at the passing throng,   you can stay here as long as you   want.
I don't have any sandpeas.
You miss him, don't you?
Nog? Maybe a little...
A little?
There isn't a day goes by that I   don't see him standing here,   pining away for that no-good   nephew of mine.
I'm not here every day.
No, just four or five times a   week. If you ask me, Nog   should've never gone off to the   Academy. You lost a friend, and   I lost a good waiter.
Nog'll be back and he'll be   wearing a Starfleet uniform. I'm   proud of what he's doing.
Remember that the next time you   try to play dom-jot by yourself.
You don't want me hanging around   here? Fine. I'll do my thinking   someplace else.
Poor kid... I suppose that's what   you get for having friends.
Meaning what?
Just when you think you can count   on them, they go off and leave you.   You're better off without   them.
I imagine that's why you don't   have any friends.
Look who's talking.
Dad, I'm home.
Mom? As Jake tries to make sense of what he sees, we:
I'm afraid I'm not your mother, Jake.
This is the woman I told you about --   the one I met in the parallel universe.
So you are Jennifer Sisko, you're   just not my mother...
That's right.
You look exactly like her.
I know.       And I was married to a man who   looked exactly like your father.       It's all a little confusing, isn't   it?
More than a little.       Did you tell her?
Tell her what?
Ever since my dad told me about   you -- I've been wanting to meet   you.
Well, here I am.
You even sound like my mother!
Ops to Captain Sisko.
Go ahead.
Minister Gettor's shuttle has   docked.
Give me a few minutes. Offer him   a tour of the station.
I already have. His time is   limited and he's anxious to meet   with the Emissary.
I'll be right there.
So why are you here?
I came to see your father.
Really? That's great.
Jennifer came to give me some good   news. The Terrans have won an   important victory.
We've driven the Alliance off the   space station.
(realizing the    importance)   Then the rebels control Terok Nor.
(with an approving    glance toward Sisko)   I see your father has told you all   about us.
I'd better get to this meeting.
I understand. It's not like you   were expecting me.
You're not leaving, are you?
Is it all right if I visit with   Jake for awhile?
I don't think Jake would have   it any other way.
Maybe the three of us could have   dinner together.
That'll depend on how long my   meeting lasts.
We'll wait.
Okay.
Would you like another raktajino?
Thank you. That would be nice.
That's amazing.
What?
I never thought I'd hold this hand   again... it feels just like my   mom's.
I'll get you that raktajino.
That went well. I think you made   it clear to the minister why the   Emissary can't endorse his land   reform program.
It only took me three hours.
If you like, we can go over the   weekly personnel reports.
In the morning. I've got someone   waiting for me in my quarters.
Jake? Jennifer?
Computer. Locate Jake Sisko.
Jake Sisko is not on the station.
You're sure this is what Smiley   used to transport you to the   alternate universe?
Looks like it.
And you're convinced Jake's gone    over there?
He's not on the station and   neither is Jennifer.
Maybe he convinced her to take him   there for a visit.
Without asking me?
It could be why she left this   behind. It's an invitation to   join them.
And I accept -- if only to get   Jake back.
You want some company? I can   think of safer places to visit.
Major, you and the Chief, come   with me.       Commander, you have Ops.
Expecting trouble, Major?
Just want to be prepared.
Energize.
Welcome back, Captain.
(looking around for Kira    and O'Brien)   What happened to the others?
They weren't invited.
Where's my son?
With Professor Sisko. She's   showing him the station.
The tour's over. I'm taking Jake   home.
Then I'm afraid we have a bit of   a problem.
What kind of a problem?
Jake's not going anywhere...
... and neither are you.
Terok Nor in rebel hands... it   goes to show what people can do   when their cause is just.
Save the speeches, Smiley. Right   now, I don't care too much for you   or your cause.
You've every right to be angry.   After all, we haven't exactly   played fair with you.
You kidnapped my son.
Kidnapped... an ugly word.
But accurate.
Tell me, Captain... if we'd come   to you and asked for help in   fighting the Alliance, what would   you have said?
I'd have said, no.
Which is why we had to use your   son to lure you over here.   Because we do need your help,   Captain. No one else will do.
Recognize her?
The Defiant.

During our last encounter, when I   "visited" your station...       ... I took a moment and downloaded   as many of your computer files as   I could. Figured they'd come in   handy one day. And they have.       You see, captain, taking Terok Nor   was one thing... keeping it, now   that's the tricky part. The   Alliance fleet is already on its   way and when they get here, I want   to give them a proper welcome.
These schematics look complete.   If you want to build another   Defiant, you don't need my help.
We've already built her. But   every time we power up the   engines, the whole ship damn near   shakes itself apart.
We had the same trouble. It's a   powerful ship.
Well, right now it's a little too   powerful for its own good. So how   did you solve the problem?
We had to overhaul the structural   integrity field grid.
How long did it take?
Two weeks.
We have four days.
I'm not sure that's enough time.

It'd better be -- or the Defiant   won't be ready and you and your   son will die along with the rest   of us... or worse, spend the rest   of your lives working in the ore   processing center under the tender   mercies of an Alliance overseer.
Help us, captain, and I promise   we'll get you and your son out of   here before the fireworks begin.       The Defiant is at Docking Port   Five. I think you know the way.
I knew you would.
Is he with us?
You remember Captain Bashir.
Captain?
Captain Bashir, Captain O'Brien,   Captain Sisko. We may not have   enough weapons or troops or ships   but we've got plenty of captains.
Is he going to help us or not?
(to Sisko, sarcastic,    re: Bashir)   I bet you missed that cheery face.       Relax, the Captain has found it in   his heart to aid us once again.
Good.
I owed you that. I let you hit me   once because I thought you were   our Captain Sisko. Now I know   better.
We're even now.
If I were you... I'd stay out of   his way.
You and I friends? I don't think   so.
Why not?
You're too tall. I don't trust   tall men.    (then looking at the    statuesque dabo girls)   Tall women... that's a different   story.       Here.
See for yourself.
Jake, isn't she a little old for   you?
Who are you -- his mother?
Jake!
Dad... I'm sorry.       But I had to come.
Somehow, talking to Jennifer...   telling her all about the last   nine years... about all that's   happened to me... what I've done,   what I've been thinking about --   it's like telling Mom.
In a lot of ways she's nothing   like your Mom.
Yeah, but in some ways, she's just   like her -- and not just   physically. She listens like Mom.   And it's the exact same smile --
Okay, Jake.

(pleased, he smiles with    relief)   This place is unbelievable...   Chief O'Brien, Doctor Bashir, Dax --   they're all here. I know, it's   not really them... but... look --   here's Nog.       This is my father.
He's tall, too.
Sorry.
Look, Jake-O... I need to speak to   Jennifer alone for a minute.
She likes you.
Jake -- whatever you're thinking,   whatever plans you're making --   forget about them.
I'm not making any plans, Dad.
Outside.
I just want to know one thing...   whose idea was this?
Does it matter?
It does to me.

It was mine. We needed you to   help us complete the ship. Smiley   had told me all about you... about   your wife's death... about your   son.       I knew Jake would want to meet me --   that I'd remind him of his mother.
You're nothing like his mother.
I think Jake would disagree.
Of course he would -- in his mind,   the three of us are already living   together.
Ben -- you're the one that   convinced me to join the rebels --   to fight the good fight for my   people.
It's not your cause I have a   problem with -- it's your methods.
I'm sorry if Jake's feelings get   hurt -- but it's a small price to   pay if it means success against   the Alliance.
All right, I'm here. And I'm   going to help. But I want you to   leave my son alone.
I can't.
Why not?
Jennifer!
Because he won't leave me alone.
Bow before the Regent!
I can't think of anything I'd   rather do.
So this is the p'tak who lost   Terok Nor to the rebels.
Are you calling me a liar?
I was merely observing that as one   of the many officers under the   Intendant's command, it would be   an overstatement to imply that I,   alone, was responsible for our   defeat.
You're the only officer who   managed to escape.
I suppose I could've surrendered   to the rebels. Groveling on the   floor, begging for my life... like   the Intendant.
You're just trying to shift blame   away from yourself.
Am I succeeding?
This time, I'll deal with the   rebels myself. And you're going   to be at my side, redeeming   yourself in battle.
Your fairness and good judgement   is everything I've heard it to be.   Believe me, my Regent, it will   take the blood of many rebels to   quench my thirst for revenge.
Spoken like a Klingon.
I'm trying.       Now, if you'll just remove this   insufferable collar...
Sisko to Smiley. I'm about to put   the deuterium injector back on-line.
Go ahead. I've got the flow   regulators shut off.
Injectors are operational.   You can recalibrate the regulators   now.
Will do.
I heard you were back.
That's for making love to me under   false pretenses. I was suspicious   of you from the start.
You hid it well.
If you ever try to touch me   again...

character: Dax whips out a long, curved dagger.DAX
quote: Get my point?
I hope not.
What happened?
You remember the Intendant, don't you?   I was taking her to an   interrogation session when the   vile little tyrant tried to   escape.
Pick her up.
Leave her. She's not through   learning her lesson.
If this is supposed to teach me a   lesson... you better turn that toy   of yours to a higher setting.
Gladly.
That's enough.
Whose side are you on?
There's a difference between   interrogation and torture.
The Alliance never made that   distinction.
But you should.
Take her back to her cell.
Well done. I must admit the last   time you were here you had me   completely fooled. I really   thought you were my Benjamin   Sisko.
That was the idea.
Help me escape and I promise I'll   be grateful. Very grateful.
I'm sure you would be. But don't   count on it.
Then perhaps you could find Marani   for me and send her to my holding   cell.
Marani?
One of my servants.       I am a touch sore.       And Marani gives the most   exquisite massages.
You're sure you're all right?
I'm fine.
I've got work to do.
In case he gets out of line.
A ship? What kind of ship?
According to our reports, it's of   unknown classification and carries   an impressive weapons array --   some kind of improved photon   torpedoes, multi-targeting phaser   banks...
How long until it's operational?
Within two days.
I know it's none of my business   but... perhaps it would be prudent   to increase our speed to warp   nine.
Quiet.
I'm merely trying to be of   service.
If it wasn't for your   incompetence, the rebels would   have been destroyed.
I thought we'd agreed that it was   the Intendant who was incompetent.   I was merely following her orders.
And for following those orders   you deserve to die.
Then why don't you kill me?       The Intendant was bad enough. She   was irrational, accusatory,   unappreciative. But at least...
At least what?
At least I was able to...       please her now and then.
You're not my type.
I never said I was.
Increase speed to warp nine.
So what do you think?
Chicken a la Sisko.
How did you learn to cook like   that?
All Sisko men have the cooking   gene. You should taste my Dad's   shrimp Creole.
Maybe one day, I will.
Come in.
Let's go, Jake. Time to call it   a day.
Care for some chicken a la Sisko?       Jake made dinner. It's wonderful.
I'm too tired to eat.       Jake-O.
In a minute, Dad. I don't want to   leave a mess.
That's not really necessary...
I want to.
How's your work on the Defiant coming?
Slowly.
Does that feel better?
But I'm not sure what you expect   to gain by it.
I'm not expecting to gain   anything. I just want to remind   you that I'm not your enemy.
I don't know why you're being so   hard on me. You pretended to be   my husband, and I've forgiven you.       By the way, you've done a good job   with him -- Jake, I mean.
Right now, you're not making that   job any easier.
He'll get over me.
Maybe.
I just wish I could say the same.

Is it really such a surprise?   Think about it, my Ben Sisko is   dead. I look at Jake and all I   can see is the son I'll never   have. Maybe bringing him here   wasn't such a good idea after   all...
For any of us.
Yes?
I just got word... the Alliance   fleet is less than eight hours   away.       Looks like we've run out of time.
You concentrate on getting the   weapons array on-line. I'll   calibrate the S.I.F. generators.
Eight hours. It's not a lot of   time, is it?
It's all we have.
Smiley -- your damn assembly crew   won't let me into the aft torpedo   bay.
That's because they're still   trying to get the torpedo   chambering mechanisms on-line.
Great. So what do I do with these   torpedoes?
(frustrated, nothing's    going right)   I've got a few suggestions.
Do you now.
This isn't getting us anywhere.   We need to buy ourselves more   time.
Any ideas?
How many raiders do we have left?
Only one. There's no way we can   stop the Alliance attack.
Maybe not. But I might be able to   buy some extra time before they   get here.
You'll never make it back.
Is that what you're worried about?   Or are you afraid I'll wind up   with all the glory?
what good is glory if you're dead?
Who said anything about dying?
When do we leave?
I've never liked sitting around in   one place for too long.
Then it's settled.
Before you go, we'd better make   damn sure you can get us that   extra time.
Me? Help you fight the Alliance?   What a perverse idea.       But I've got a better one... why   don't I cut your throat? A quick   death. And far less painful than   what the Regent will do to you.
I think you'd better worry about   what the Regent's going to do to   you.
The Regent has no reason to   question my loyalty.
It's not your loyalty he'll be   questioning -- it's your   effectiveness. After all, he   wouldn't have to retake Terok Nor   if you hadn't lost it in the first   place.

I didn't lose anything -- it was   Garak and the rest of those   Alliance fools... with their   excessive brutality. I could   never get them to understand that   violence is a precision   instrument. A scalpel, not a   club.
Garak was smart enough to escape.
Garak's a coward. He ran at the   first sign of danger.
Probably straight into the arms of   the Regent. where he no doubt   laid the blame for the loss of   this station entirely on you.
You have a point.
Good. Then I'll ask you again --   is there any weakness in the   Alliance fleet? Something we can   exploit... ?
It's possible. Why don't you   lower this forcefield and join me   in here?       It might stimulate my thought   process.
I would think self-preservation   would be stimulation enough for   you.
That's not a very friendly   attitude, considering you want my   help.
It's Professor Sisko, isn't it?   Well, she is attractive but I've   known Breen icicles that are   warmer than she is.
This has nothing to do with her.
If you say so.
I never was able to resist anyone   named Benjamin Sisko. Alliance   ships are fast and powerful... but   they do have one weakness.
Their targeting systems can be   fooled. They've been known to   chase warp shadows.
How do I know I can believe you?
You're just going to have to trust me.
The key -- where is it?
You're not listening, I didn't   take the key.
You're lying.
(with angry    embarrassment)   I'm telling you he stole it from   me while I was feeding him.
Don't make me ask you again.

What good would the key do me?   Even if I unlocked this collar --   where could I go? I can't get off   this ship. And besides, you've   searched me three times already --   where could I possibly be hiding   it?
Perhaps you swallowed it.
Impossible. I'm very particular   about what I eat.
We'll see about that.
Regent...
What is it?
The key, sir...       ... somehow it had fallen into my boot.
Now do you believe me?
(to the guard, re:    Garak)   If he dies, you die.
Six Rebel raiders approaching.   Bearing three-five-four mark zero-   zero-eight.       Their sensors have detected us.   They're fleeing.
A wise choice. But they won't get   far.
They're coming after us. I hope   these warp shadows we're emitting   are going to fool them.
We'll know as soon as they start   firing.
You look like you could use    another pair of hands.
Smaller ones might help.
Here, let me.
I'm trying to calibrate the torque    sensors.
To control the inertial dampers.    I know. It's Professor Sisko,    remember?
Sorry.
For what it's worth, you should    know I've told Jake the truth.       About my visit to you... why I    brought him here... everything. Sisko's interest is piqued.
And?
He said it didn't matter. He's    still glad to have met me.       And the funny thing is I know he    means it.
He has a forgiving nature.
It's more than that -- I don't    think he could be angry with me    even if he wanted to. I remind    him too much of his mother.
He loved her very much.
I've never had anyone care about   me like that before.
So if it's all right with you,    I'll see to it that he's sent back    to Deep Space Nine.
When?
Right away.
What's Smiley going to say about    that?
He trusts you to finish your job.    And so do I.
You want to say good-bye to him?
I better finish here. Tell Jake    I'll see him soon.
Ben, when we first met... there    was a connection between us...
And now... because of what I've    done -- it's gone, isn't it?
I'm not sure it was real to begin    with.
I better go get Jake home.
Hey -- what are you doing there?
Nothing. I'm just... thinking.
Well, think somewhere else.    You're making me uncomfortable.
What's so funny?
Where I come from, it's you and I    that would hang out here, and it's    your uncle that chases us away.
Am I suppose to be impressed by    that?
I don't care about some parallel    universe -- I only care about this    one. And in this one, I run a bar    and you do your thinking in your    quarters.
All right, you made your point.
I'm waiting.
I'm going.
Good.       You're a long way from home, hew-   mon.
I guess I am.
Jake, I need to speak to you.       In private.
Sure.
Tell me something, are you as    bored as I am?
I'll take that as a yes. I bet if    we put our... heads together, we    could create a little excitement for    ourselves.
You sentenced my wife to death.
Isn't that a coincidence... I was    hoping you weren't married.
I've prepared the Intendant's   dinner.
Show me.
Nicely done.
Thank you.
I have a ship waiting for you on   Landing Pad C.
I'll need this more than you will.    (as she checks the power     levels on disruptor)   I wasn't aware we were on the same   side.
You killed my father and my uncle.       Thanks to you -- I own the bar.
Jettison the docking scaffold.       Time for you to go, captain. I    believe that was the agreement.
scene: not stock, we can lose it.)54   INT. DEFIANT - BRIDGE

quote: I'm on my way. Just wanted to    wish you luck.
scene: not stock, we can lose it.)54   INT. DEFIANT - BRIDGE

quote: Thanks.
scene: not stock, we can lose it.)54   INT. DEFIANT - BRIDGE

quote: You've given us a fine ship.
scene: not stock, we can lose it.)54   INT. DEFIANT - BRIDGE

quote: I only wish I had a chance to get    to know her before taking her into    battle.
scene: not stock, we can lose it.)54   INT. DEFIANT - BRIDGE

quote: Oh, well... nothing like a little    on-the-job-training to get the    adrenalin pumping.
scene: not stock, we can lose it.)54   INT. DEFIANT - BRIDGE

quote: Get out of that chair, Smiley.
scene: not stock, we can lose it.)54   INT. DEFIANT - BRIDGE

quote: What do you mean?
scene: not stock, we can lose it.)54   INT. DEFIANT - BRIDGE

quote: Just do it. O'Brien does as he's asked; Sisko sits in the chair.
scene: not stock, we can lose it.)54   INT. DEFIANT - BRIDGE

quote: Seal the airlock, release docking    clamps. Aft thrusters at one    quarter impulse.
scene: not stock, we can lose it.)54   INT. DEFIANT - BRIDGE

quote: What are you standing there for,    Smiley?
scene: not stock, we can lose it.)54   INT. DEFIANT - BRIDGE

quote: Captain, you never cease to amaze    me...
scene: not stock, we can lose it.)54   INT. DEFIANT - BRIDGE

quote: Sometimes I even surprise myself.
scene: not stock, we can lose it.)54   INT. DEFIANT - BRIDGE

quote: How long will the station's    shields withstand the Alliance    assault?
scene: not stock, we can lose it.)54   INT. DEFIANT - BRIDGE

quote: Long enough for us to see just how    tough this ship of yours really    is.
scene: not stock, we can lose it.)54   INT. DEFIANT - BRIDGE

quote: Let's find out. Take us out of    here.
scene: not stock, we can lose it.)54   INT. DEFIANT - BRIDGE

quote: You're sure you want to leave now?
Hopefully, this new rebel ship    will keep the Alliance busy while    I get to Bajor. I have friends    there who'll hide me.
Well, don't worry, about me -- I    won't tell anyone where you are.
Nog.
You're right. You won't tell    anyone.
I don't see why you can't come to    Deep Space Nine with me.
scene: 58   INT. ANOTHER PART OF THE DOCKING RING CORRIDOR
location: ANOTHER PART OF THE DOCKING RING CORRIDOR

quote: Believe me, Jake, it's better in    the long run if I don't... for all   of us.
scene: 58   INT. ANOTHER PART OF THE DOCKING RING CORRIDOR
location: ANOTHER PART OF THE DOCKING RING CORRIDOR

quote: Jennifer. You look as beautiful    as ever.
scene: 58   INT. ANOTHER PART OF THE DOCKING RING CORRIDOR
location: ANOTHER PART OF THE DOCKING RING CORRIDOR

quote: A bird of prey has locked onto us.
Evasive maneuvers. Pattern Delta.
Pattern Delta? What's that?
Rock her, port to starboard!   Hard.
Got it.
Can't lose her.
Hard to port.
Fire!
I'll have to remember that one.
I really must thank you, Jennifer.    Not only will you guarantee my    safe passage off the station, but    you'll make a perfect gift for the    Regent.
scene: 69   INT. TEROK NOR - DOCKING RING CORRIDOR

quote: You want me to go with you --    fine. But leave the boy here.
scene: 69   INT. TEROK NOR - DOCKING RING CORRIDOR

quote: Why's he so important to you?
scene: 69   INT. TEROK NOR - DOCKING RING CORRIDOR

quote: That doesn't matter. You're not    taking him.
scene: 69   INT. TEROK NOR - DOCKING RING CORRIDOR

quote: I've never seen you so passionate.    It gives you a lovely glow.        All right... he doesn't have to    come.
scene: 69   INT. TEROK NOR - DOCKING RING CORRIDOR

quote: No!
scene: 69   INT. TEROK NOR - DOCKING RING CORRIDOR

quote: Now that was unfortunate.
scene: 69   INT. TEROK NOR - DOCKING RING CORRIDOR

quote: She needs a doctor.
scene: 69   INT. TEROK NOR - DOCKING RING CORRIDOR

quote: I'm afraid it's too late... for    both of you.
scene: 69   INT. TEROK NOR - DOCKING RING CORRIDOR

quote: Just out of curiosity, why was she    protecting you?
scene: 69   INT. TEROK NOR - DOCKING RING CORRIDOR

quote: (more to Jennifer than     to Kira)   She's... my mother.
scene: 69   INT. TEROK NOR - DOCKING RING CORRIDOR

quote: Your mother?    (then, putting it all    together)   You're Sisko's son. From the   other side.
scene: 69   INT. TEROK NOR - DOCKING RING CORRIDOR

quote: In that case, give your father a    message for me. Tell him I spared    your life... and that's a debt I    intend to collect.
scene: 69   INT. TEROK NOR - DOCKING RING CORRIDOR

quote: Shields down to forty percent.       That cruiser has us in weapons'    range. Do we make a run for it?
We run all right... right    at it.
(with devil-may-care     aplomb)   Pattern Suicide.
Concentrate your fire on that    ship.
It's changing course...       Heading directly toward us.
Good. That should make things    easier.
Terok Nor will soon be ours again.    And then you can spend the rest of    your life contemplating your    failure as you labor alongside the    other slaves in the ore processing    center.
It's nice to have something to    look forward to.
Shields down to twenty-five percent.    One more hit could finish us.
Then we have to make sure we don't    get hit.
I'll take the helm.       Nothing personal, I just know this    ship better than you do.
I want that ship destroyed -- now!
They're flying too close -- we    can't target them.
We've put a hole in their forward shields.
Nice shooting, Smiley.
Hold on -- a bird of prey just    locked on to us.
On screen. Secondary power to aft    shields.
What secondary power? You've got    to get us out of here.
Can't risk giving the cruiser a    clear shot.
Damn... I was just starting to    like this ship.
Bashir to Defiant. Aren't you    going to welcome me back?
I never thought I'd be happy to    hear your voice.
You'll get over it.
Sisko to Bashir. Concentrate your    fire on their forward shields.
With pleasure.
Forgive me, my Regent -- but   perhaps the moment has arrived to   remove your august presence from   the battefield.
You mean retreat?
I hope I'm not out of line?
The cruiser is changing course...       They're going to warp.
The other Alliance ships have    broken off their attack on the    station.       We've won.
You sound surprised.
Surprised? I'm astonished.       Not that I'm complaining...
I've been betrayed.
There can be no other explanation    for my defeat.
I certainly can't think of any.
The traitor must be found and    punished.
She will be.       It is the Intendant we're talking    about, isn't it?
The Intendant... yes, of course.
All I ask is that when the moment    comes, you allow me, your humble    servant, the honor of    administering her punishment. I    promise you, she will regret her    disloyalty before she dies.
And while you dispose of the    Intendant, I'll dispose of the    rebels.
Make it so.
Dad!       See -- I told you he'd be here.
